result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques A Linwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 4 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to Court costs and DNA surcharge.  PAID IN FULL.  Balance of cash bail to be refunded to poster.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counseling and follow through as deemed appropriate by Agent.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No contact with the victim or any member of her family listed in the criminal complaint or witness L.B.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Marques A Linwood in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.  
Jury Trial Canceled.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest (alfred plea) to count 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 4.
Counts 1, 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.
Victim presented statements to the court.





Court orders the following:
Count 4:
90 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
4 Days Credit.
Stayed.

Term of Probation: 1 Year.
Court will allow transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Anger Management or Domestic Violence Counsel and Follow Through as deemed appropriate by agent.
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim or any member of her family listed in the criminal complaint or witness L.B.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs:  $243
DNA Surcharge:  $200
D.V. Surcharge:  $100
Apply Bail and Refund Balance to the Posting Party.
